result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew C. Hetzel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay costs and DNA surcharge through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office. Defendant to establish a payment plan within 60 days (11/23/15). Defendant to pay costs of supervision.
Defendant shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as recommended by Agent.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew C. Hetzel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew C. Hetzel in court with attorney William Ginsberg.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. will plead today; Court reviews recomm.; Court reviews charges and penalties; Def. pleads Guilty to Count 1 Battery/DAR; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; victim rights complied with; parties stip. to facts; Court finds plea made FVK&I and finds Def. guilty of Battery/DAR w/Count 2 D&RI; State heard; Atty. Ginsberg heard; Def. makes statement; Court imposes sentence

**W/H - 18 mo. PO
- $343 CC through CofC
- $200 DNA surcharge
- absolute sobriety
- counseling as deemed approp.
- AODA & FT

Def. FTA for Return Date; State appears by James Sempf; State requests warrant; Court authorizes warrant and forfeits bond.; State now notes that a Cont. was signed and case is set for tomorrow at 12:30pm
Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.

9:36 - Defendant, Andrew C. Hetzel in court, Intern Kevin Schmidt w/ADA James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court enters Not Guilty plea. Court finds probable cause. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Return date scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 08:15 am.
